name: Financial Promotions & Consumer-Facing Communications
description: Policy governing the creation, approval, and monitoring of financial promotions and customer-facing communications.

sections.title: Purpose and objectives
sections.summary: Set the objectives for clear, fair, and not misleading promotions.

sections.title: Scope and applicability
sections.summary: Define channels, roles, and communications covered by this policy.

sections.title: Definitions
sections.summary: Clarify what counts as a financial promotion.

sections.title: Clear, fair, and not misleading
sections.summary: Set expectations for balanced, plain-language communications.

sections.title: Prominence of risk warnings
sections.summary: Ensure risks and limitations are visible and proximate to claims.

sections.title: Target market and Consumer Duty
sections.summary: Confirm audience fit and Consumer Duty alignment.

sections.title: Substantiation
sections.summary: Require evidence for claims, comparisons, and numerical statements.

sections.title: Approvals and third parties
sections.summary: Set the approval workflow and third-party controls.

sections.title: Digital and social communications
sections.summary: Apply rules to short-form and social channels.

sections.title: Records and evidence
sections.summary: Define the promotion file and record-keeping standards.

sections.title: Monitoring and review
sections.summary: Set ongoing monitoring and update expectations.

sections.title: Red flags and escalation
sections.summary: Define red flags and escalation expectations.

sections.title: Training and awareness
sections.summary: Require training and attestations for staff involved in promotions.

sections.title: Governance and accountability
sections.summary: Define oversight, accountability, and review expectations.
